title: [Large-Scale] Pre-Socialization MOOC for Adapting to Online Higher Education: Foundations of Academic Language Learning and Advanced Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational digital literacy or online learning experience. However, possesses high school-level basic grammar comprehension and everyday reading/writing skills. Requires basic proficiency in academic text comprehension
context.additional_context: A program for adult learners preparing for university that addresses psychological barriers to online education and supports the formation of learning communities. It focuses on essential higher-education language skills such as academic writing, presentations, and discussions, emphasizing the acquisition of specialized vocabulary and the cultivation of critical thinking-based expression abilities.

learning_goals: Learners can explain ≥3 fundamental learning strategies required in online higher education (e.g., academic text analysis, specialized vocabulary expansion, logical expression structures).
Learners achieve ≥80% participation by practicing interaction methods (academic grammar accuracy, clear scholarly expressions, constructive feedback) with peers in virtual discussion forums.
Learners must submit a time management and study-life balance plan (including weekly schedule, priority matrix) within one week, fulfilling ≥4 of 5 checklist items provided.
Learners can utilize ≥5 basic functions of online learning platforms (Zoom, LMS) and use ≥2 language learning tools (digital academic notebooks, collaborative writing platforms).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
